newsitem.title: SWAZILAND: Golf-Druian takes third-round lead in Swazi Open.
newsitem.headline: Golf-Druian takes third-round lead in Swazi Open.

text.p: South Africa's Warrick Druian, borrowing a little from the Tiger Woods philosophy on golf, opened up a two-stroke lead after the third round of the Royal Swazi Open on Saturday.
The 27-year-old Druian, still without a win after six years as a professional, fired a seven-under-par 65 for a 54-hole total of 199 - 17-under for the tournament.
He effectively made up four shots on overnight leader and playing partner Nic Henning of South Africa, who carded a third round 69 to slip back into second place on 201.

England-born Chris Davison struggled a little with his putting for a 69 and third place on 203 while Scotland's Derek Crawford, who plays out of Norway club Trondheim, carded the low round of the day with an eight-under 64 to share fourth place on 205
Druian, who picked up an eagle-three, six birdies and one bogey during his round, said later that he had learned a bit about dominating on the golf course from American sensation Tiger Woods.
"I've been watching a lot of Tiger Woods on television and he always looks like he owns the golf course when he plays," Druian said.
"In the past, I always used to think like a winner on the golf course but, if I then wasn't as good as other players, got frustrated and performed way below potential.
"But I now feel that I belong on the tour and tomorrow I just want to go out there and dominate on the course."
Englishman Michael Archer, playing at the back of the field in the morning, made a rare albatross-two at the 484-metre par-five fifth hole at the Royal Swazi Sun Golf Club.
After holing his three-wood approach, Archer went on to card a 68 for a 54-hole total of 213.
